Llewellyn, who was first seen in ''[[The Country Wife (The Green Green Grass)|The Country Wife]]'' in 2005, is Boycie arch nemsis and neighbour farmer. Ray Harrison, who was first seen in ''[[Testing Times]]'' in 2006, is the local landlord. Dora, who was first seen in ''[[The Lonely Herdsman]]'' in 2007, is Marleneâs mother, Dora. They are also seen in ''[[Brothers and Sisters (The Green Green Grass)|Brothers and Sisters]]'' in 2006 and ''[[Home Brew]]'' in 2009.
Llewellyn, who was first seen in ''[[The Country Wife (The Green Green Grass)|The Country Wife]]'' in 2005, is Boycie arch nemsis and neighbour farmer. Ray Harrison, who was first seen in ''[[Testing Times]]'' in 2006, is the local landlord. Dora, who was first seen in ''[[The Lonely Herdsman]]'' in 2007, is Marleneâs mother, Dora. The Driscoll Brothers, who are first seen in ''[[One Flew Over the Cuckoo Clock]]'' in 2005, are the reason Boycie is on the run. They are also seen in ''[[Brothers and Sisters (The Green Green Grass)|Brothers and Sisters]]'' in 2006 and ''[[Home Brew]]'' in 2009.

+
''The Green Green Grass'' has also featured several notable guest appearances to date. Series One featured Denzil, an ''Only Fools and Horses'' regular, The Driscoll Brothers, who also appeared in the parent program and Sid, who was a irregular character in ''Only Fools and Horses''. Series Two saw guest appearances from [[Ian Bonar]] as Simon, [[Paul Bown]] as Colin and once more, The Driscoll Brothers. The Third Series saw Dora, Marleneâs mother, make two appearances and [[George Wendt]] guest as Cliff Cooper. The Fourth Series has so far seen another guest appearance from The Driscoll Brothers, a guest appearance from [[Jeremy Clyde]] as Tristram and a further guest role from [[June Whitfield]] as Dora. [[Status Quo]] played the end credits for the Series Four episode, ''[[Animal Instincts]]''.
